“I wanted you to pick it because it felt special… but I was dumb enough to not say anything, but I was too shy to… and since you’d helped me so many times I wanted you to be a part of it in some way…”

“That’s so sweet.” You giggled and traced across the rings with your fingertips, feeling the surface of the dainty silver.

“I should get rid of it though… once we’re done I’m never going to assassinate for anyone ever again and then I’m going to throw it away.” His voice sounded determined.

He squished you closer against his body briefly as he reached for his hand with his other to pull the ring off and to your surprise he tossed it across the room.

The silver clinked loudly as it hit the wooden floor and rolled away across the room.

“I want to wear something else on this finger anyway.”

“Like what?”

“If I ever get married one day, I’ll need this finger in particular.”

Your cheeks were burning from his words and you hid your face against his chest.

He laughed softly at your reaction and patted your back.

“Baby… Are you tired? Why are you hiding from me?” He teased.

“It’s sleep time!”

“No it’s not.” He giggled and moved his hand to your waist to tickle you.

“No!”

“Yes!”

“Taehyung stop!” You laughed, squirming and trying to get away from his hand by climbing over him. A dumb choice and a fortunate mistake in once.

He wrapped his arms around your waist and pulled you down, rolling on top of you and crashing his lips against your neck and continued to tickle your waist.

Your cheekbones were aching from the laughing and he finally stopped. Instead he moved his lips from your necks to yours and kissed you slowly and passionately, sliding his hands further up your sides.

It had almost a soothing effect on you the way he slowly caressed your lips with his own.

After a short while he pulled away and nuzzled your neck.

–

You shook the hand of the real estate agents and said your goodbyes after being shown around multiple properties and quite a few that caught your liking. You were handed a pile of papers of each property to look over in private before making any further decisions and you eagerly received them.

In the car on your way back to the hotel your phone dinged, as it would… but this was a text from and unknown number…

You could feel your heart sink.

“You have 24 hours.”

You immediately forwarded it to your contact.

“I just got a text and it says I have 24 hours… I think it’s from him.”

Taehyung suddenly hit the brakes hard and did a drastic U-turn.

“Where are we going!?”

“The airport.”

“I knew I should’ve gotten rid of our phones!” He groaned and hit the wheel.

“They’re giving us a lead to him at least, I forwarded it already.”

“I’m not taking any more risks. The second they find him we get on the next plane back and I’m fucking killing him.”

“Back from where?”

“Whatever flight has seats available, we’re leaving the country either way.”

“Are you sure!?”

“I am! Turn your phone off!”

With one hand on the wheel he grabbed his own out of his pocket and handed it to you.

“Turn it off too and throw them out of the window.”

“What!?”

“Just throw them out!”

You turned his phone off and rolled down the window and tossed them out on the side of the highway hard, smashing them both.

Adrenaline began to take over and Taehyung stepped on the gas harder.

“How are they going to call us now if they find him Taehyung!?”

“Fuck! Maybe they have computers we could borrow or an internet café at the airport, anything!? We can send them and email? I didn’t think about that, fuck I’m so dumb!”

“I didn’t think about it either until it was too late, there’s nothing we can do about it anyway. What’s done is done.”

He left the highway at the exit leading towards the airport and parked the car at the first available spot.

The two of your rushed in and luckily found a hotspot area with computers and you quickly logged onto your email while Taehyung frantically searched for tickets to purchase.

“Our phones are out of order, please contact us on this email as soon as you can!” You sent.

“Please respond fast.” You begged.

“There’s a flight to Vienna in four hours. Should I book it?” Taehyung asked, clearly distressed judging by the sound of his voice.

“Let’s- Let’s just wait five minutes in case he responds and calm down, ok?”

Five minutes felt like an hour and you impatiently refreshed the page and to your relief you saw a response.

“I just tried to call you. We tracked the location of the text and it came from your house.”

Taehyung looked over at your screen and read the email over and over again.

“How did he make it past the security gates? There are guards!”

You exchanged brief eye contact with each other.

Vienna or going back and hoping he’d still be there?

Taehyung leaned over to your side and clicked down the browser on the computer, stood up, grabbed your hand and ran back towards the car, dragging you along.

The choice was made.

–

“He could be waiting for us.” Taehyung said, speeding.

“Then what?”

“I have a gun hidden in the trunk, just in case; we’ll use that and end it once and for all.”

You reached your neighborhood in no time and used your key card to open the gate.

“What happened to the guard?” You questioned, looking out of the window.

“We don’t have time to investigate.”

Taehyung stopped the car as the gate closed behind and quickly ran out to grab the gun from the trunk and took his seat behind the wheel again.

Everything seemed normal, even the atmosphere and no car was parked near you house or on your driveway. The only car in sight was the car parked in your neighbor’s driveway.

Even the door to your house was locked.

Maybe he had just left? Or just roamed around the outside?

“This feels really weird…” Taehyung said in a low voice, keeping you close by his arm around your waist.

He unlocked the door and pushed it open carefully.

Everything was still intact…

But he had clearly been here? At least according to the position of his location unless he had it hidden but then how on earth would it show your house?

Nothing made sense!

You looked around the first level and Taehyung stopped you by the stairs.

“Wait down here and I’ll look upstairs.” He handed you his gun but you refused to take it.

“What if you need it?”

“What if you do?”

“They’re after you, not me…”

“Take the gun.” He said in a strict threatening tone.

The odd feeling came crawling and you felt more and more of a bugging gut feeling.

“Wait.” You said and ran out into the kitchen to grab a knife.

“At least take this.”

He took the knife from you and began walking upstairs.

Should you check the basement while he checked upstairs or stay?

The best would be if you had each other backs but he was being so stubborn.

You looked around the living room. It was familiar to the sight but unfamiliar to the feeling…

The gun was held tight in your hands, unloaded as you walked around the large space.

“If you’re here… he’s upstairs. Come out so we can talk.” You whispered and loaded your gun.

“How could you tell I was here honey?” A voice suddenly whispered, making you jump. You slapped your hand over your mouth to not scream as you quickly turned around and spotted a dark dressed tall young man approaching you from his hiding.

His hair was short and black and he was strongly built, if it wasn’t for that he had threatened to kill the love of your life you would’ve admitted to him being attractive.

“Are you Jungkook?”

“Correct.”

“So, are you going to do it?”

You aimed your gun at his forehead.

He scoffed.

“I expected you wouldn’t.”

He took a few steps closer, clearly not intimidated by the gun.

“Say how much do you know about chemistry?” He asked, tilting his head to the side and reaching into his pocket.

You took a step back.

What type of question was that?

Should you just shoot? Call out for Taehyung? For some reason your mind couldn’t make a decision and Jungkook took yet another step closer to you.

“Guess we’ll have to go with plan B.” He muttered and pulled out a cloth from his pocket.

He was too fast.

He grabbed the gun and aimed it away from him with strong force and kicked your leg, tackling you to the ground with a loud sound, loud enough to alert Taehyung that something had happened. But before you knew it the room turned foggy and you lost consciousness.

The cloth was drenched in a strong odor, whatever it was made you black out and within seconds Jungkook had your thrown over his shoulder and ran out to the car he had parked in the neighbor’s driveway.

–

You woke up in a seated position, feeling drowsy to say the least.

Heavy chains were holding you in place against the chair.

“Oh you’re awake.”

Not the voice you wanted to hear.

“Do you want some water?”

You didn’t respond.

The room was dark and you could tell where Jungkook was standing but not much else.

Where were you?

You blinked a few times and your vision gradually became clearer.

It was a basement, clearly. A filthy basement with a bunch of newspapers scattered over the floor. In the corner of your eye you could spot a dimly lit area with metal tables with some sort of chemistry equipment on… meth perhaps? Since he was also in the same circles?

Jungkook caught you looking over at the home lab.

“Do you know how much money I lost when the police confiscated almost everything I had?”

“Huh?” He poked your shoulder hard.

“That guy you killed was my one employee; you couldn’t have picked another spot?”

“It was his home?”

“It wasn’t, but I had him written as the person owning it to use him as my scape goat, I didn’t care about him, but I cared about my shit that got taken away! I have people I need to deliver to! If I don’t deliver to them they send people like you on me!”

Was he trying to make you feel bad for him? Because it wasn’t working.

“That sucks.”

“Yeah, it does.”

“I’ve sent a message to your man by the way, who I happen to know that you’re dating because your webcam security is faulty as fuck…”

Oh gosh…

“100 million and he get you back, with almost no scratches…” He pulled out a pocket knife and stroked it against your cheek with a wide smirk.

“The sooner he finds you, the less scratches… see it as a game.” He folded the knife back and put it back in his pocket.

“He has 42 minutes until the first one.” He walked away and sat by the tables of the home lab corner.

–

Panic.

That was the only feeling mixed with rage that ran through his veins as he opened the safe in his office, taking all he could carry from guns, diamonds worth more the ransom he asked for and an emergency phone he stored there… just in case.

He forwarded the email to the contact and immediately called him the second the phone turned on.

“Hey, I just read the email what the hell is going on?”

“He took her Jimin!” He cried out. “Please just find him… I’m panicking.”

Using your contact’s name was something your tended to avoid out of respect but Taehyung was desperate.

“Hold on, hold on… took her?”

“He kidnapped her! He wants me to pay a ransom to get her back and then I’m going to fucking kill him!”

He grabbed everything with his free hand and shoved it into a gym bag.

He couldn’t do this without you… You always made him stop and think clearly, being in this alone felt like a disorganized mess… this was why he needed you, an “assistant” that he so happened to fall in love with upon first sight…

“We’ll get on it right away.”

“Don’t hang up!” He begged.

“Alright, alright.”

Taehyung rushed out to the car and tossed the bag onto the passenger seat while listening to Jimin type away at his computer.

“That’s odd…” He pointed out.

“What is?”

“He didn’t conceal his IP, I have the exact address.”

“He wants me to find them.”

“Or he’s an idiot…”

Jimin gave him the address and Taehyung quickly put it in the navigator.

“Thirty minutes!?” He snorted. “I can make it in 15.”

“Thanks Jimin.” He sniffled, hung up and started the car.

–

“Thirteen minutes… what should I do with you huh?” He slapped you across the face.

A few minutes ago you witnessed him take a dose of whatever substance and it was clearly having an effect on him…

He laughed.

“You have a nice face.” He smirked and grabbed your chin.

“I’ll save it for last.”

“That old dude, he used to call me impatient… pffft, maybe he was right…”

He disappeared behind you and returned with a flogger in his hands.

“10 minutes princess, start praying…”

You kept the cold stare at him, refusing to show any expression, neither fear or hope.

He was high out of his mind, eyes shot red.

“Drugs are bad for you, you know that right?”

“Are you getting Stockholm Syndrome one me now? Why do you care?” He laughed.

“You wish.”

“I do!”

“Everyone just keeps using me.”

“Didn’t you use the guy we killed?”

“That’s different!” he pointed the flogger at you.

“The world owed me that one, I’m still guilt free.”

You rolled your eyes.

“I can’t wait this long.” He complained.

To your surprise he took a seat sideways on your lap.

“What do you do besides killing people? Do you collect stamps?”

“Stamps?” You gave him a judging look.

“Yeah, stamps.”

He got back up again.

“He won’t make it either way.” He groaned and raised his arm.

You kept by your decision to not give him the reactions he wanted.

But it was hard.

As the sharp ends of the flogger slapped across your thighs you had to bite down on your lip hard to hold back.

Convincing yourself that you could withstand it was pointless by the fifth time… he wanted to see blood and wounds and wouldn’t stop until you were “scratched.”

By the eight he tossed the flogger on the floor and you dared yourself to look down at your red, bleeding thighs.

The tights you were wearing were of course torn and ripped by the sharp end in no time, leaving your skin exposed for the brutality.

“He has 30 minutes till the next; I don’t want to wait another hour.” He muttered and disappeared behind you again.

He returned with a glass of water and offered it to you but you leaned away from it in rejection.

“Suit yourself then.” He scoffed and took a seat on his chair again.

“Do you like crack?”

“I don’t mess with drugs.”

“Too bad.”

–

Taehyung parked the car in front of a worn down house. The neighborhood seemed to be gradually torn down as the space between each house was oddly large and looked somewhat like an abandoned construction site.

He took out a gun from the bag, concealed it by the hem of his jeans under his coat and grabbed a second in his hand. He shoved two of the diamonds he brought with him in his coat pocket, both of them neatly wrapped in a dark blue velvet boxes.

Taehyung walked up the door and had a quick listen before opening it. he wasn’t surprised to find it unlocked.

–

You both heard sounds coming from upstairs.

“Is he here?” Jungkook questioned and stood up.

Your muscles relaxed slightly at the relief.

Jungkook had randomly showed you his tools as a sort of “entertainment”, laughing at a screwdriver for an entire minute because it had the word “screw” in it…

He took his knife out and your suspicion of him not possessing any actual weapons increased…

You hoped Taehyung had a gun.

Where your gun from before had gone you had no clue of and it clearly wasn’t around.

Maybe he was too much in a rush to kidnap you to think of grabbing the gun as well? Or it was waiting upstairs… Not knowing was probably the worst.

–

Taehyung looked around the messy place before finding the door leading to the staircase down into the basement. It felt like a likely place…

But before he could approach the door it swung open and he stood eye to eye with the face of his new enemy.

He immediately raised the gun.

“Do you have the money?” Jungkook asked, ignoring the weapon.

His nonchalant attitude was intimidating in its own way… may it be that he was high or that he had no fear but treated it like dust.

“Let me see her first.”

“Yeah yeah, she’s downstairs.” He waved Taehyung along.

By now he had noticed the red in his eyes.

He was making it too easy…

Taehyung followed Jungkook down the stairs and the first thing he spotted was the small pool of blood beneath your legs, haven dripped from your thighs.

He couldn’t hold back his gasp and his hands shook.

Before heading upstairs Jungkook had pulled a piece of fabric over your mouth tightly. But luckily it wasn’t drenched in anything… but it was disgusting.

“What the fuck did you do?”

“You took too long. Another minute and I would’ve pulled out her finger nails.” He laughed.

“You’re sick.” Taehyung shoved his hand into his pocket and pulled out one of the diamonds.

“It’s worth 173 million, it’s more than you asked for but I don’t care.”

“I wanted cash, not diamonds.”

“You can trade it in for cash, idiot. I have another worth 246 if you want that one instead.”

“And what if it’s just glass?”

“Try and break it.”

Jungkook took the box and opened it, taking out the clear cut jewel and throwing it against the concrete floor.

It slid across the floor, near you, still intact.

“Fine.” He muttered.

Taehyung loaded his gun with a click and pressed it under Jungkook’s chin.

“Now un-tie her.”

“You think I don’t know you want to kill me?” He laughed and pulled out the gun from before, concealed in the hem of his jeans.

Fuck…

He aimed it back at Taehyung.

“After all what I really wanted was you dead and asking her was just for fun… I wanted to see if she’d actually do it.” he threw a glance towards you with a smirk.

Taehyung lowered his gun and fired it as his shoulder, making him lower his gun and wince in pain.

“You’re dealing with someone who’s doing this for a living. Did you think I’d ever show any hesitation in firing a gun? You clearly are new to this…”

His shirt was stained with blood.

“Untie her!” He yelled and Jungkook walked over to you, he dropped the gun to press his hand against his wound and kneeled down behind you to unlock the chains with the key in his pocket.

His hand quickly stained red and there was a clink when the chains suddenly feel.

You freed your arms and got rid of the cloth by your mouth and almost threw yourself towards the gun on the ground.

Jungkook picked up the diamond with his bloody hand and stood back up.

You loaded the gun and aimed it at Taehyung.

His eyes went wide and he immediately dropped his own gun, surrendering.

“Hand over the diamond and I’ll shoot.” You yelled at Jungkook.

“Just leave!” He groaned.

“W-what are you doing?” he whispered, heartbreak echoing loud and clear in his voice.

You held a hand out towards Jungkook for him to hand you the diamond.

“Isn’t this what you wanted?” You yelled.

He started laughing.

With your attention aimed at Jungkook, Taehyung kneeled down and picked his gun back up. The click from the trigger being pulled half way stole your attention back.

He aimed it under his own chin.

This wasn’t what you wanted!

“Hand her the diamond.” He ordered, holding back tears.

“Now this is a show…”

You quickly aimed the gun away from Taehyung and shot Jungkook in the leg, making him fall over and you snatched the diamond from him and put it in your pocket.

You turned to Taehyung and place your gun under your own chin, triggering a tear to fall down his cheek.

“Hand me the gun babe.” You ordered.

Without hesitation he released his grip and handed the gun over to you.

“You’re never touching one of these again.”

You still held your gun at your chin.

“Hand me the other one.”

“Baby…”

You pulled the trigger half way and he quickly grabbed it out of the hem of his jeans.

“Why are you doing this?”

“I want the pay for my kill.” You said and removed the gun from your chin.

You walked over to Jungkook.

“I’m not killing you, but I’m killing your business.”

He looked confused.

“You asked if I know chemistry earlier, remember?”

You walked over to his lab corner and found the lighter he had used while taking a dose and simply set the entire lab on fire.

“No!”

The flammable content on the table immediately caught flames.

“Escape while you have the chance.” You said  and threw the guns into the flames and immediately grabbed Taehyung’s hand, pulling him along upstairs as the toxic fumes filled the basement.

He was in shock.

“Where’s the car?” you yelled as you escaped the house, but he failed to respond.

You spotted it yourself down the street and grabbed the keys from his coat pocket, dragging him along as you ran.

“Get in!”

You took a seat behind the wheel and grabbed the random gym bag in the passenger seat and threw it into the backseat so Taehyung could sit.

The adrenaline was rushing through every part of your body, taking over so much that you had completely forgotten about the wounds on your thighs.

You made a sharp U-turn and speeded away from the house.

After a short while you heard Taehyung sniffle beside you and you threw a quick glance at him.

His face was red and he was straining to hold back his cries but to no use.

He hid his face in his hands.

You let him cry out.

You were nearing the exit to your neighborhood when he suddenly cried out his first words.

“I- I thought you turned on me.”

“I’m sorry if I scared you honey…”

“Scared me? You made me think you didn’t love me! You broke my heart!”

“I love you.”

“It felt like I got shot.”

“I’m sorry.”

“Give me the diamond.” He sniffed.

“Why? It’s covered in blood”

“Just give me the diamond!” He cried out.

You reached into your pocket, driving with one hand briefly and got out the blood stained diamond and handed it to him.

He took it out of your hand aggressively and clicked the window down and threw it out.

“I never want to see it again!”

“Baby, don’t get me wrong, I didn’t take it because I wanted it, I took it so he couldn’t use it for gain.”

“I know, I got that when you said you were killing his business but I still never want to see it again because my heart got crushed for a stupid rock.”

He wiped his nose with the back of his hand.

“How can I make it better?” You asked desperately.

He looked down at his lap.

“Go to Vienna with me…”

–

Not being in a rush for once meant that you had time to rent a last minute private jet to take you to Vienna… and pack a suitcase.

A mere day later, less than 24 hours later you were up in the air on your way to Austria.

Who knew how long you’d be gone…

You just had to leave and if this was enough for his heart to repair you would gladly agree to it without hesitation.

What you did was gruesome and you understood if he needed time to heal.

He was till distant and withdrawn, not saying much but he still allowed you to caress his fingers over the table as you approached the airport in Vienna.

“I bought more diamonds… they’ll be delivered next week.” He said, trying to break the silence while looking out of the window.

“Taehyung let’s not talk about work.”

“I don’t know what else to say…”

“What do you want to eat when we arrive?”

“Pizza.”

“Then pizza it is, what kind?” You continued, trying to change the subject and gripping his hand tighter.

He took a deep breath.

“There’s a place I want to go first.”

“Where is that?”

“You’ll see when we get there.”

“Is it a surprise?”

He nodded shyly, expression still serious.

“I’m doing it for my heart.”

“Doing what?”

“You’ll see.” He repeated.

–

Once the plane landed you were immediately driven towards one of the beautiful palaces in the city area.

“I just want to relax after this…” He whispered.

“We will and when we come home we’ll burn our shoes, we never did that last night.” You hoped it would cheer him up.

“I want to burn my one-hundred ring along with the shoes.”

You caressed his cheek, if it wasn’t for the fact that you were sitting in the backseat of a car with a driver in front, you would’ve told him many more things.

You looked down at his hands tightly held by your and noticed the shimmer at his sleeves.

“You’re wearing the cufflinks!”

“Of course I am… and you’re wearing the earrings… I noticed it earlier.” He confessed shyly.

“We should get something matching.”

For some reason that sentence made him crack a smile and chuckle softly.

The driver stopped the car and you got out in front of the palace.

It was dark and the garden was lit up by multiple lights.

“This way.” Taehyung said and guided you by the hand through the park until you got to a large fountain.

“You wanted something matching?”

He went down on one knee and your heart rate spiked with a soft gasp.

He took out a red velvet box from his coat pocket and opened it for you, showing the two dainty rings, one with a large diamond and the other lined with diamonds around it.

“Marry me… will you?”

“Yes!” you giggled, no doubts.

He smiled cutely and took the ring with the large diamond out of the box, placing the box carefully on his knee and reaching for your hand.

He slipped it on your ring finger for you and took a second to admire it on your hand.

“Can you put mine on me?” he asked and took the box again, standing up.

“You have an engagement ring too?” You smiled widely, taking it out of the box.

“Why wouldn’t I? I’m engaged too.”

You put the ring on his finger and it sparkled the most out of all. You held on to his hand with both, too taking a moment to admire when his hand suddenly cupped your cheek, tilting your head back to face him before he crashed his lips against yours.

His hand slipped out of your hold and he wrapped his arm around your waist, pulling you closer.

You rested your hands against his chest.
trail.content_abstract:
x Taehyung

❧ AU:  Hitman!Taehyung || You worked as an ’assistant’ for Taehyung and had for a long time.

Over the course of that time you had slowly developed feelings for him and it was getting harder and harder for you to be around him with the lingering desire for him.

Did he feel the same way? Or should you quit your job and move on?

But quitting a job as a professional assassinator wasn’t that easy…

One day he suddenly stopped the car abruptly as you were talking, unable to handle himself anymore and your life took a twist where desires were endlessly meet…

It would’ve been a happy story if it wasn’t for the one kill that changed it all…

|| ANGST + SMUT | 22k | x reader ||

❧ Disclaimer: This is fiction. Actions and events in these stories are often exaggerated and to a certain degree unrealistic.  Please have this in consideration when reading fiction, especially if it includes sexual content.

❧ Rating: EXCPLICIT || very sexual themes throughout the story, unprotected sex, blood, killing, drug use, kidnapping, gun use, flogging, death threats, illegal activity, tax fraud.

❧ Smut features: (In no particular order) Top!Tae (mainly), Brat!Tae, Brat tamer!Reader, Quickie, on a desk, Oral; eating out, BJ, cock warming, lowkey sex addicts, begging, teasing, in the shower, grinding, thigh riding, “sit”, bondage, rigger!reader, neck holding (chocking intimidation), cum denial, orgasm denial, neck kissing/sucking, spanking, fingering, “suck”, orders…
